headline: Trump thanks CNN's Jim Acosta for his accidental endorsement of a border wall
subHeadline: After Jim Acosta tweeted video meant to downplay President Trump's claims of a border crisis, Trump thanks Acosta for his 'salesmanship' of the effectiveness of a border barrier.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: All right. You've been watching a press conference by the Barron County Sheriff, Chris Fitzgerald, there, taking as many questions as he can on the remarkable story of Jayme Closs escaping her captivity, being found safe and alive. He has got as much information as he can. We will go around the table and talk about this a little bit. And, again, Greg, it's remarkable that she was found, 88 days. We don't know a lot how she escaped or how she was being held, but they did find what they think could be the shotgun that murdered her parents.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I sympathize with the Sheriff and that I have nothing to say and it's frustrating when you watch press conferences. But, you know, when they pepper this individual's questions and, you know, what can you say. It's a horrible crime for this young girl. Her ordeal is just beginning, actually, because, you know, she's been through three months of some kind of captive ordeal. And now, she has no parents and her life is forever changed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Indeed. What about -- I think, Jedediah, her wherewithal to be able to escape. And apparently, as the Sheriff said, her captor was out of the house of the time.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I mean, it's actually an incredible thing when you think about it. It's great to hear that she's not responding and talking. I can't imagine how traumatizing this must be for a kid and now her new reality, I know she is with her aunt, reunited with her family. Some of the things that stuck out for me, though, I was expecting this to be someone that knew them. And the Sheriff coming out and saying as of right now, no social media connection known, nothing to suggest that there has been contact. There was contact with the suspect and her or her family. Although he did say that the parents worked, I believe, at the same plant. I'm curious that's going to lead to something that maybe the suspect did know them. The Sheriff clearly saying that Jayme was the target, not necessarily sure if she was being stalked. But something's going to come out here, I think, that we're going to discover about the story, because it's a very strange wind-down, to see. And I'm just glad she's OK. It's actually incredible what she's been through and where she's at right now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The Sheriff, Juan, said that the suspect will be charged on Monday at 3:30 p.m. Wisconsin Time.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Right. It sounds like one of the key pieces of evidence is the gun, which was used not to just kill those two people, James and Denise Closs, but also to destroy the front door. So it's a part now they can really put together and bases. And secondly, that he had shaved his head, again not only to avoid detection, but to avoid leaving here at the scene.  And on the touching part that Jedediah was saying, not only is she in good shape, but apparently, when she went into the home of these two people, Kristin and Peter Kasinkas, who said that the wife said it was like seeing a ghost. This girl had been missing for three months. Everybody assumed the worst, that she started playing with the puppy. And that, to me, that's a great sign of her mental health and mental stability, and again, evidence, as you were saying, Dana, that this young woman saved herself, she found a way out.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And, you know, they make movies and books about people who find that kind of fortitude and heart in themselves, but for a 13-year-old, it's pretty incredible.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse, your thoughts on the last minute that we have here?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Unfortunately, they do not have the death penalty in the state of Wisconsin. They eliminated that a very long time ago. So this guy is going to serve life when he is convicted. I am sure he will be convicted once they get the ballistic evidence from the shotgun that was used at the crime. Very premeditated by shaving his head to eliminate any sort of forensic evidence as well. You know, I just think, right now, everybody is going to flood the zone with producers from 2020 and from Dateline and they're just trying to score an interview with this young girl. And I hope we give her some time to heal before she's ready to come forward. And I know the generosity of this country is going to be there for her, whether it's financial or any type of generosity. Hopefully, she will get over this and she will survive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Thank you for that. Coming up, why President Trump is actually thinking Jim Acosta.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. The partial shutdown entering its fourth week and now tied for the longest in American history. Thousands of federal workers did not get their paychecks today. President Trump has been grappling with whether or not to declare a national emergency in order to build a wall, now says he will not be doing that for the moment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Twenty four hours ago, you are saying you were going to declare a national emergency.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I said I could do it, but I tell you what, it's the easy way out. But Congress should do this. This is too simple, it's too basic. And Congress should do this. If they can't do it, if at some point they just can't do that, this is a 15-minute meeting, if they can't do it, I will declare a national emergency. I have the absolute right to do it. It says as clear as you can.  I'd rather not do it because this is something that Congress should easily do. This is something that the Democrats should do. And I don't want to give an easy way out of something as simple as this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Democrats are voicing their concerns over the president's tough stance.

utterances.speaker: REP. KATIE HILL, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: This is like a toddler who is having a tantrum and you can't give in. It really is a tragedy. This is, to me -- I know it's a strong word. But to me, this is political terrorism.

utterances.speaker: REP. PRAMILA JAYAPAL, D-WASH.
utterances.sentences: His ultimate goal is as you said to make America pure in the sense of not having immigrants, not having folks of color here and shutting down every form of legal immigration.  So, Jedediah, this is a big change now. We kind of go up and down and the plot takes a twist, I don't know, like a TV or something. It's like a TV series. But he says now, he's thinking it's not the right thing. It's Congress' responsibility. I have noticed that National Review, Wall Street Journal, conservative outlets, have both said, they think it would set a terrible precedent.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Yeah. And I said here yesterday I didn't think he was going to do that, even though he is right. He can do it. He is within his authority to do so. The thing here is, they don't disagree on the issue. Chuck Schumer believes in border security. He voted for it. He agrees that fencing works. Donald Trump believes that it works. Barack Obama is out there, has been talking about this humanitarian crisis. This is not about the issue on immigration. This is about Donald Trump. This is about the fact that he made it front and center and these Democrats can't stand him and they are making the political fight. They don't want him to be able to run in 2020 and say that he fulfilled a campaign promise. And they don't want him to be right. So if anyone is making this political, it's the people on the left. And they need to make a decision. Look, he is within his authority. I think it was good that he brought up this Emergencies Act of 1976 and talked about his authority to do it. It wasn't a threat, but he was saying listen, if you force me, I'm going to do this, this is not a manufactured crisis.   And all these Democrats talking about race, it always makes me laugh when they say that. More than 51 percent of border patrol agents are Hispanic. This is not about what color you are, whether you're white or you're brown. This is not about that. This is about drugs, this is about human trafficking. And anyone who makes this about race is really, really pathetic in my eyes and doesn't have a strong argument. And maybe, the more they're making that point about race, when President Obama and Chuck Schumer or Nancy Pelosi were all fighting for border security, and voting for border security, no, they weren't. They're making it about race because once again, that is a campaign talking point that they need against Donald Trump. It's a lame and it's not going to stick.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Jessie, you know, a quick way to ask this question is, how long is this going to go on? Is this going to on until the State of the Union? I think Dana had predicted that a couple of weeks back, but what do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, whatever Dana predicted is probably right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Probably right. But what do you think is the way out, what's the end game?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think the end game is some external event is going happen, it's going to shake-up the dynamic. Because right now, there is just too much intransigence on the side of the Democrats, they are not negotiating. Donald Trump is the only one negotiating and they're not. Let's just think about what happened yesterday, when he was down at the border of McAllen and they have the border patrol agents say that in just one day, they apprehended 135 individuals. In one day. That means they probably missed some. And they were from 41 different countries besides Mexico and Central America. The Chinese, Romanians, Pakistanis. This is not about race, this is about any human being that comes across.   If you are at a party and all of a sudden you don't recognize that person or that person -- you don't recognize that person, it's your house. Who are these people? And then you say, hey, who are you, where are you from? And they go, you know, I just let myself in the backdoor. It was unlocked. That's just not the way to run a party. It's not a way to run a country. And every American can understand that. You just want a sense of who is in your own house and who is in your own country.  Dana said yesterday, and I just want to double down on that, there are cracks that are beginning to show within the Democratic caucus. I saw another interview with the House Democrat that said sure, I'd be willing to vote for a little border patrol fencing, or fencing for the border patrol, that's fine. It's starting to slip and the mainstream media is doing as much as they possibly can to keep that from happening.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Dana, one of the things that the president said was Congress should act. And what we have seen today is a rising pressure coming actually -- it's sort of bipartisan, on Mitch McConnell, the Senate Majority Leader, to force, to vote on something and then give it to the president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think Mitch McConnell has played this very well. There's a poll yesterday that showed this question, who do you blame for the shutdown, 51 percent the president, 35 percent Democrat, 5 percent Mitch McConnell, which means that he is actually -- he has a higher approval rating than he has taken the blame for this issue.  For me, and he's just sitting back and saying, I will wait, until you guys tell me what he'll sign. And so, I think that Chuck Schumer can't get it done, so he is like please, Mitch McConnell, bail me out. No, thanks, I think that's actually really a dumb thing to do. The other thing is that the president said something today. The Democrats should have said it, let's do that. He tweeted this morning about h1b visas. This is for your high-tech people, your smarts, like all those brainiacs that you want to have. And he said, I have an idea, why don't we provide you a path to citizenship. Don't go to other places. Come to America, we want you. Why don't they take him up on that deal?  For $5.7 billion, you get border security plus you get some of the things you wanted, dreamers and other things, administration -- administrative law judges. I do want to point this out though, we can still have a little bit of fun. You guys remember yesterday. We showed you this from Jim Acosta, down at the border. Take a walk -- take a look.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN CHIEF WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Here are some of the steel slats that the president's been talking about, right here. As you can see, yes, you can see through these slats to the other side of the U.S.-Mexico border.  But as we're walking along here, we're not seeing any kind of imminent danger. There are no migrants trying to rush toward this fence here in the McAllen, Texas, area. As a matter of fact, there are some other businesses behind me along this highway. There's a gas station, Burger King, and so on. But no sign of the national emergency that the president has been talking about.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Good job yesterday. I appreciate your -- salesmanship. I appreciate your salesmanship.

utterances.speaker: ACOSTA
utterances.sentences: I didn't see -- I didn't see an invasion at the border.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You didn't. That's because we had a wall.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The president doesn't miss anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you can -- you can say a lot about Donald Trump, about his character. You could say you don't like him, you think he's rude or impulsive. But there's one thing. He has a master troll game.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He, for that alone, deserves to be on Mount Rushmore. Because what he does is so new and refreshing to the press. And I just never get tired of it. Just writing, "Dear diary" above Jim Acosta's tweet was priceless.  But look, to the other points before we go. Somebody mentioned political terrorism. Political terrorism is when you believe that what is worse than a humanitarian crisis where children are exploited, women are raped, and federal workers go without paychecks, what is worse than that is compromising with Donald Trump. That's actually political terrorism. And it's really refreshing to see so many leftists, you know, cry racism about slowing -- slowing -- illegal immigration, not stopping it. And ignoring how the influx of the illegal immigration actually depresses wages and jobs for minorities. Somehow, they overlook that.  That's all I got. This crisis is now a circus, and a circus has two ingredients. Right? Clowns and children. The children are the politicians. The clowns are the media. And they just indulge each other. So it's never-ending. And you're never going to get a solution as long as you let the media and their business model influence this issue.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So the president is still in a corner, and we'll see how it plays out.  Up next, Jesse's got "The Fastest Seven." You really don't want to miss this on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. Time for "The Fastest Seven." First it was Senator Elizabeth Warren's bizarre beer-drinking live stream that had many on the Internet scratching their heads. And now it's failed Texas Senate candidate and possible 2020 contender Beto O'Rourke's live stream of a visit to the dentist that again has people asking, why? Take a look.

utterances.speaker: BETO O'ROURKE, D-TX, FORMER SENATORIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: So I'm here at the dentist, and we're going to continue our series on the people of the border. I'm here with Diana, my dental hygienist. Diana is going to tell us a little bit about growing up (ph).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He went a little too far, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what? I blame AOC. Because she has been so successful on Instagram that now everybody has -- every politician has to do it. But nobody wants to see the inside of your mouth, including even dentists, I find, are not pleased with the inside. That's why they get paid the big bucks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We're not even getting paid to look into his mouth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And people hate going to the dentist. No one wants to see someone --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Unless you get the laughing gas.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, that is true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Then it's awesome.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He was actually the original AOC. I mean, the reason he was able to garner all that $38 million to run against Ted Cruz is because all he did was Facebook videos and livestreamed his video.  Here's the thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He was cooking steaks then.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My big concern, Jesse, is that this is very unconventional, and we could be normalizing this behavior. So I'm concerned.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's true. Very unpresidential.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Or maybe it's modern-day presidential. Who knows?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So this, to me, is where we are in politics today. It's all about social media and appearing authentic and genuine, and "I'm a real guy, like you do. And you know, here I am at the dentist, and I don't like it. And I can talk while I've got the stuff in my mouth," which is amazing to me. But I think back. I think we were talking a moment ago, Jedediah and I, about Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez dancing to some music. I forget what song it was. And then, you know, initially, it was the conservatives mocking her, but then everybody came and said --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No conservatives mocked her. That is a lie, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a lie. OK, find it. Please find it. It is a lie. It is a lie. Find it for us. In the break, in the break. In the break, find it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We did a whole monologue on it. Jedediah, take it away.

utterances.speaker: JEDEDIAH BILA, HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think this stuff works, though. I've got to say.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's right. I think it's authentic.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I think it really works. I think it does make them relatable. I mean, I don't want to see anybody getting their teeth cleaned but a really funny tweet from Ben Jacobs at The Guardian, he said, "God, I hope Beto O'Rourke doesn't need a colonoscopy any time soon."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to steal that one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm having mine on Wednesday, by the way. It's not a laughing matter. Everybody should get it done.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'll be filming it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Please don't. Don't you just love flight attendants?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are you telling us absolutely everything?

utterances.speaker: JULIE HAGERTY, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Not exactly. We're also out of coffee.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So now you have the option to show them that you truly care. Frontier Airlines offering passengers the option to tip them. The sky-high gratuity running into some turbulence, though, from their union, who fear the practices will keep wages low and encourage people to treat the cabin crew like in-flight waiters. I'm against this, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Of course you are, you cheap freak. Tipping -- tipping is a transaction that makes the world a better place. You know, if you can encourage somebody to go out of their way to do something better, why not?  You don't tip people for doing their job. You tip them for going out of their way. If they do something special like they give you a free drink, right, or they upgrade you, or they give you a better pillow. You should always -- you reward that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can tip to get an upgraded seat? Now I changed my mind. I'm into it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I -- I think the union has a good point about them being treated like waiters. Because they are there for your safety, as they remind you every time you get on. The other thing is, nobody carries cash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: True.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So maybe you give them tips as piece --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Advice?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- like pieces of advice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know, you can stop knocking my leg with the drink cart. All right. Go ahead, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I mean, the -- the question to my mind is, aren't you paying for this when you buy the tickets?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, the prices are high.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You're paying for a level of service. Now Spirit Airlines, I was on the Spirit the other day, they make you pay for everything. Not only additional baggage but you have to buy peanuts, cokes, coffee.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They just did that to you, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It could have -- it could have been. It could have been. It could have been.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: "I charged them for peanuts, and they bought it."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The other part --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "The guy from 'The Five.'"

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The other part of this is, hey, you know what? So somebody gets on who doesn't have either money in their pocket or can't afford it and they're going to get treated worse, even though they paid the same for a seat. That doesn't seem right.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Yes, good point.  I think people will start carrying cash, though, on planes if they know they can tip, because the service will be better. Everybody knows it. Everybody likes to get tipped. And I always tip well, because I used to be a waitress.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: And that was the only money I ever made, because you get paid, basically, nothing except the tips. So now I just -- I feel sympathy, and I like everybody likes to be tipped. And if you --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's "tip well"? What, are you, 25 percent?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I tip above.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Twenty-five?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I tip very well. I do, because that's the only money I ever made. I was broke, and I was, like, grateful for good tips.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Twenty-five.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Yay!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I've got to write a book like Jedediah.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: It's very hard work to be a waiter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Now for some robot on robot crime. Russian robotics company Promo Boy is claiming that their autonomous robot was struck and killed by a self-driving Tesla as the metal guy was making his way to the consumer electronics show in Vegas. Some are calling this fake news, saying it's a P.R. stunt. Greg is actually taking a driver's test next week.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: OH, BOY.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So I wonder if he could drive better than a robot?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I haven't driven a car in ten years.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So that's no.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, ten years. I don't even -- I'm not even sure I will understand what's in front of me, because cars have changed so much since the last time I drove. And the cars that I drive are old cars. The last car I drove is from 1957. So I have a car -- I have a car that has no seat belts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And on --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to make a booster seat joke. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And on Monday, we're going to quiz you so you can get ready for your driving test.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm taking the written exam on Tuesday. I've been reading the entire book. And also, a lot of -- they have, like, rules about in-line skating.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you sure it's the right book?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've got to study that? In-line skating?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Stay tuned for Greg's quiz on "The Five" on Monday. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, first of all, there's no way Greg could be a better driver than a robot, even if he hasn't been driving. The reason we're having this push towards self-driving cars, No. 1, is safety.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And so it turns out robots are much better than people who drive and they're distracted or drunk or --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It will eliminate 90 percent of all accidents, self-driving.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So I don't -- I'm not particularly comfortable getting in a car that's controlled by a machine. But on the other hand, I read the numbers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You feel more comfortable in the car with him?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because I know him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No airbag on your side, Juan.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I just can't believe you studied for that. I would get in the car with you. I think you did your homework. I feel like you could be a good driver. Maybe a little road rage, but that never hurt anyone.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All road rage.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm a terrible passenger, I will tell you that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You are -- you're going to be the king of road rage. But you won't get out of the car.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I won't get out of the car.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very tough behind the wheel, though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then I hope we don't both stop at the red light together.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Because you're going to run the red light. All right. Don't go anywhere, Greg has got your Fan Mail Friday questions ready to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's great music.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. That was my life in the '80s, I guess. "Fan Mail Friday." Stop talking, Greg. All right. I love this question. This is from -- would you say "Cherry" or "Sherry"?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sherry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sherry? Baby?

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Cheri K. "A space alien arrives and says 'Take me to your leader.' Where do you go first?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Space alien arrives and says, 'Take me to your leader." Where do you go first? Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'd say here he is. You met him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what you can say?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You could say, "This is 'Watters' World.'"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Welcome to my world." And then they kill you. And you say, "I should have said Gutfeld."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I guess I would say Jeff Bezos.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I'd say Mrs. Bezos.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think I'm going to have to go with NYPD. Like, find any NYPD officer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's the practical maneuver on your part. You're very practical today, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Another practical -- Jed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Just today?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Today.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I would go to my mom. I'm not kidding. My mom is a boss.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: She's always right. She's listening to this now, and she's like, "I told you so." But no, I would go to my mom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know who I'd go to?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: She's right too much.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dilbert?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Scott Adams?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What about Scott Adams?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He could persuade them not to hurt you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Scott Adams could persuade the aliens, but Lou Dobbs would put them in their place.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "I'm Lou Dobbs." All right. @FrenchiFirecracker --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "What's the most cringeworthy outfit you've ever worn?" And it can't be the one you're wearing today. Jed.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Got one.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Very funny. I like this dress.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is it a magic?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Dana complimented me before the show. Cringeworthy outfit, probably a Halloween costume.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Yes, I dressed up as Madonna one year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you dressed up as Batman. Do you remember that?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Batman?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Or was it --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I was a cat that year. That was not Batman.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's it. You were Catwoman.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Catwoman.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: But that was a nice costume.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Believe me, if you thought that was bad, the Madonna one was really bad. Really bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan. You've lived through some decades. Let's face it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: My friend Jesse gave me a cringeworthy outfit for Christmas, and I wore it. I wore it. I wore the snowflake outfit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that was nice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: To mock myself. Yes, I did. On the other hand, I think -- I saw a picture of myself the other day in overalls when I was a softball player way back, and I had no shirt. And I thought, you know, "Why am I wearing that?" I mean, it looked great, but I'm kind of embarrassed about it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Overalls are strange if you're not on a farm. It's unusual, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I like an overall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I had a few cringeworthy outfits back in the day. I had, you know, the starter jackets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why could -- you could just go back to "Watters' World" with the collar.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, those were --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Upturned collar?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I had red Champion high-tops. But I think the most cringeworthy, there's a picture of me with an afro and a kilt from a -- I think it was, like, 1998. I don't think that would fly in this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- in this year.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But yes, that's pretty cringeworthy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So in third grade, my mom -- my mom, we didn't have, like, all the fancy clothes other kids had, and she gave me these corduroys; but they were, like, the thin corduroys. And they were this ugly, like, puke brown/green color. And it was third grade, and she made me wear them to school. And I'll -- honestly, I can remember like it was yesterday. It was so mortifying. I was really embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can -- I had a similar -- when I was in first grade, my mother, I was the narrator for the -- what do you call the Christmas play? The nativity -- what do you call it? You know with the manger, all that stuff? I can't remember what the --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesus. Yes. I had to do the "And the wise men came and there was no room."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I've heard this story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. I did.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Had to read the story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I had to do the narration, because I was the only one in first grade who could read. So my mom made a suit, but it was a suit with shorts. So I was up on the auditorium stage in shorts but wearing a suit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I wore that on "Outnumbered" a few years ago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think you did.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: He did wear that!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what? It was the same suit. All right. "One More Thing," next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. It's time now for "One More Thing." I had a couple of good Samaritan videos to show you. The first one comes from Milwaukee, where this bus driver, she's driving and she sees there's a toddler that is walking along the highway by itself, and so she stops and goes and gets the little one --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Ohh!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and makes sure that the little girl is unharmed, and she was reunited with the family. So obviously, that's a good Samaritan act.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then, next act of kindness happened in Lakewood, Colorado, where three teens came to the rescue of a woman whose wheelchair got stuck in a patch of dirt off the side of the road. The boys lifted the chair out and made sure she was OK to keep going on her way. And good Samaritans like that deserve a shout-out and serve as examples for the rest of us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why do they have to be Samaritans? Why can't they be anybody? Gee whiz, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan, help me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. How about ringing in the new year with a discovery? And yes, I definitely said "ring." Watch this.

utterances.speaker: WILL FRYE, FOUND LOST WEDDING RING
utterances.sentences: It was kind of -- looked like a doughnut hole, but it had a little shine through it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was Will Frye. He bought a '72 Oldsmobile from a 93-year- old Ray Schmuecker. When he took the engine apart, he found a wedding ring that had been lost for 45 years.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Schmuecker's late wife was angry when he lost the ring. Look at this.

utterances.speaker: RAY SCHMUECKER, SOLD CAR
utterances.sentences: I really treasured it, so my wife, she went right back to John (ph) the next day and bought another one.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So now he has two rings, and his daughter -- by the way, she's suffering from breast cancer, which killed her mom, has taken the discovery of the ring as a sign.

utterances.speaker: ANA CABANA, SCHMUECKER'S DAUGHTER
utterances.sentences: That everything is going to be OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, good luck to you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Indeed. OK, we're going to go now to Jesse --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- who has a great "One More Thing."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't you like rotary phones, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I used to love one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I still do. And young people now, they don't know what a rotary phone is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Great pitter-patter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So this guy, Kevin Bumstead, gave a rotary phone and gave his son and his nephew four minutes to dial one number, and they couldn't do it. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: KEVIN BUMSTEAD, CHICAGO RESIDENT
utterances.sentences: You have four minutes to dial that phone number.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So -- oh, no, zero's over there.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Restart it. What's with all the holes, though? If this is zero, then --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They couldn't do it. The four minutes elapsed right as they got the hang of it. But I mean, rotary phones, I like -- I like how it feels against my ear. You know what else is really nice against your ear? The sound of "Watters' World." Eight p.m. Eastern, we have Ron Paul, remember him?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What a great way to introduce him: "Remember him?"

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The Mooch!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He must be thrilled.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We always remember the Mooch. And Diamond and Silk. And of course, a porn star turned preacher, only on "Watters' World."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's rarely the reverse. Although I'd watch the hell out of that. All right. Tomorrow night, 10 p.m., "The Greg Gutfeld Show." I've got David Angelo. I've got Jimmy Failla, Kat Timpf, Tyrus. Saturday January 12, it's going to be great. And now of course, you know what it's time for -- GUTFELD (singing): Animals are great! Animals are great! Animals are great!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Two things I really like. I like animals, and I like taking a bath. And when you put them together, there's nothing better. Like this little guy here. He just had a bath. And he's getting -- what do you think that is, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. A chinchilla?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. Close.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Hedgehog?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a chipmunk.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Hedgehog?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's not --

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: That's not a chipmunk!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: How about a squirrel?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's a prairie dog. And then she stops, see, and then he gets very angry. It's a prairie dog. A prairie dog. You can have a pet prairie dog. Look how much he enjoys and appreciates getting touched. All animals, human and otherwise, enjoy being touched. GUTFELD (singing): Animals are great! Animals are great! Animals are great!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jedediah, can you top that?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I can. This Sunday -- also quickly, I will be at Barnes and Noble in the Staten Island Mall, 2 p.m. You better come, because I need, you know, fans to show up. Anyway, you can name a cockroach after your ex- for a dollar ninety-three. This is amazing. I think I'll name one after Kyle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: It's true. The Hemsley Conservation Center offering wounded lovers the chance to get back at the one that broke your heart. Less than two bucks, man. And you know what? It's called the Bottom of the Barrel Creatures party. You get a certificate, and your ex's name proudly displayed outside the center.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can you use Kyle's real name?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: I'm going to call him Kyle. That is his name.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kyle the Cockroach.

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: Kyle the Cockroach.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Can you smash -- you get to smash them?

utterances.speaker: BILA
utterances.sentences: No, I mean, you get to name them. So --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Smash them with your shoe. All right, that's it for us. See you next week. "Special Report" is up next. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC.
